info.name: ApigeeX
info.description:
We have developed this Apigee API collection for use against ApigeeX instances.

## Getting Started

Here's how to get started.

1. Go to the GCP console and generate an OAuth2 token from the Terminal (make sure you have access to the Apigee instance and are switched to that project)
2. Using the OAuth2 token, save it to an Environment variable called `gcp_oauth_token`.
3. Fill in other environment variables as you need them, such as {{org}} for the Apigee X project and {{env}} for the environment.
    
4. Now use the requests as shown in the collection.
    

We hope you enjoy the collection, and please send us any feedback or if you'd like further details on the services we offer.

### Contact us at: [info@sonrai.com.au](https://desktop.postman.com/?desktopVersion=9.22.2&userId=8084908&teamId=430530)

### [Sonrai Consulting Pty Ltd](https://sonrai.com.au)

## Further detail

See API documentation for more details and for API calls missing from this collection:

[https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/reference/apis/apigee/rest](https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/reference/apis/apigee/rest)

item.name: ApigeeX API Management
Getting Started
Generate GCP OAuth Token (with JWT script)

exec: // Set headers for JWT. Google service acounts rely on RSA SHA-256 and JWT token format
'exp': currentTimestamp + 3590, // expiry time is 3590 seconds from time of creation
// Replace characters according to base64url specifications

request.description:
This Request generates an OAuth token without needing to get one manually from the GCP Console.

1.  You will need to have generated a JWT Private Key from GCP using a GCP Service Account*, and store this in an Environment variable called `{{jwt_private_key}}`
2.  You will also need to populate the following Environment variables:
    1.  `jwt_iss` - issuer
    2.  `jwt_scope` - scope
    3.  `jwt_aud` - audience

Use this, after you have got a JWT token from GCP, to generate an Oauth token direct from GCP

*NOTE: The Service Account must have the required GCP permissions to access the ORG/Project for the Apigee instance.

Reference doco:

*   [https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2/service-account#httprest](https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2/service-account#httprest)
    

Alt URLs:

*   [https://oauth2.googleapis.com/token](https://oauth2.googleapis.com/token)
*   [https://www.googleapis.com/oauth2/v4/token](https://www.googleapis.com/oauth2/v4/token)

urlencoded.description: Input valid JWT here, including the signature

request.description:
Use this request, **after** you have got a JWT token from GCP. This will generate an Oauth token direct from GCP.

To get a valid JWT you will need the iss, scope, aud, exp and iat.

Example JWT before base64-encoding:

```
{"alg":"RS256","typ":"JWT"}.
{
"iss":"761326798069-r5mljlln1rd4lrbhg75efgigp36m78j5@developer.gserviceaccount.com",
"scope":"https://www.googleapis.com/auth/prediction",
"aud":"https://oauth2.googleapis.com/token",
"exp":1328554385,
"iat":1328550785
}.
[signature bytes]

 ```

Example JWT after base64-encodoing:

```
eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpc3MiOiI3NjEzMjY3OTgwNjktcjVtbGpsbG4xcmQ0bHJiaGc3NWVmZ2lncDM2bTc4ajVAZGV2ZWxvcGVyLmdzZXJ2aWNlYWNjb3VudC5jb20iLCJzY29wZSI6Imh0dHBzOi8vd3d3Lmdvb2dsZWFwaXMuY29tL2F1dGgvcHJlZGljdGlvbiIsImF1ZCI6Imh0dHBzOi8vd3d3Lmdvb2dsZWFwaXMuY29tL29hdXRoMi92NC90b2tlbiIsImV4cCI6MTMyODU1NDM4NSwiaWF0IjoxMzI4NTUwNzg1fQ.UFUt59SUM2_AW4cRU8Y0BYVQsNTo4n7AFsNrqOpYiICDu37vVt-tw38UKzjmUKtcRsLLjrR3gFW3dNDMx_pL9DVjgVHDdYirtrCekUHOYoa1CMR66nxep5q5cBQ4y4u2kIgSvChCTc9pmLLNoIem-ruCecAJYgI9Ks7pTnW1gkOKs0x3YpiLpzplVHAkkHztaXiJdtpBcY1OXyo6jTQCa3Lk2Q3va1dPkh_d--GU2M5flgd8xNBPYw4vxyt0mP59XZlHMpztZt0soSgObf7G3GXArreF_6tpbFsS3z2t5zkEiHuWJXpzcYr5zWTRPDEHsejeBSG8EgpLDce2380ROQ

 ```

  
**Reference doco:** [https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2/service-account#httprest](https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2/service-account#httprest)

#### Alternative to this request

Alternatively, to get started and make calls to the Apigee X API:

1. Get a token:
    1. From GCP Console:
        1. Login to the GCP Console
        2. Start a CLI session and switch to the Google cloud project you're running Apigee X from.
        3. Run this command and save the GCP token:  
            `gcloud auth application-default print-access-token`
2. Use the token in a variable `{{gcp_oauth_token}}` as a bearer token in the subsequent requests in this collection.
    

**Alt OAuth2 URLs:**  
[https://oauth2.googleapis.com/token](https://oauth2.googleapis.com/token)  
[https://www.googleapis.com/oauth2/v4/token](https://www.googleapis.com/oauth2/v4/token)

item.description:
Although you can use one of the following 2 requests to generate an OAuth token using a service account (and a JWT from the service account), it can be difficult to get a successful outcome.

Instead we recommend you generate your own OAuth token from the GCP console using this command:

`gcloud auth application-default print-access-token`

Then simply paste the token into the Environment variable _gcp_oauth_token_

Use the appId to paginate to the next list (use if there are over 1000 apps).
limit the number of rows (maximum 1000)
Optional. Set to true to expand the results. This query parameter does not work if you use the count or startKey query parameters.

Optional.

This parameter can be used with Apigee Edge for Public Cloud only.

Limits the list to the number you specify. The limit is 100. Use with the startKey parameter to provide more targeted filtering.

Optional.

This parameter can be used with Apigee Edge for Public Cloud only.

To filter the keys that are returned, enter the name of a company app that the list will start with. For example, if the an unfiltered list returns:

devapp1
devapp2
devapp3

Then, if your startKey is devapp2, the returned list will be:

devapp2
devapp3

request.description:
Lists all apps created by a developer in an organization, and optionally provides an expanded view of the apps. All time values in the response are UNIX times. You can specify either the developer's email address or Edge ID.
Apigee recommends that you use the developer's email address when calling this API. Developer IDs are generated internally by Apigee and are not guaranteed to stay the same over time. 
A maximum of 100 developers are returned per API call.
You can paginate the list of companies returned using the startKey and count query parameters.
 
Documentation ref: https://apidocs.apigee.com/management/apis/get/organizations/%7Borg_name%7D/developers/%7Bdeveloper_email_or_id%7D/apps
List out an app details

query.description:
Filters on various properties (e.g. filter=(request_verb%20in%20'POST','PUT'), and in sample value - the specific developer app name

https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/use-analytics-api-measure-api-program-performance#filteringresults
https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/analytics-reference#filters

Use the select query parameter to specify the metrics to retrieve, and an optional aggregation function, in the form.

https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/use-analytics-api-measure-api-program-performance#specifying-the-metrics-to-return

Use the timeRange query paramater to specify the time period (US format), in the form:
MM/DD/YYYY%20HH:MM~MM/DD/YYYY%20HH:MM
Do not use 24:00 as the time because it wraps around to 00:00. Use 23:59 instead.

request.description:
Average transactions per second (across all API calls, including errors) through the API in a given period of time.
Use the analytics metrics API to gather detailed metrics on the Consumption Data Product (AEMO Electricity Meter Reading Data API).

Documentation reference: https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/use-analytics-api-measure-api-program-performance

query.description: The filter expression to be used to get the list of AppGroups, where filtering can be done on status, channelId or channelUri of the app group. Examples: filter=status=active", filter=channelId=, filter=channelUri=
Count of AppGroups a single page can have in the response. If unspecified, at most 1000 AppGroups will be returned. The maximum value is 1000; values above 1000 will be coerced to 1000.
The starting index record for listing the AppGroups.

item.name: Analytics / Metrics API

query.description: Use the select query parameter to specify the metrics to retrieve, and an optional aggregation function, in the form.

Use the timeRange query paramater to specify the time period (US format), in the form:
MM/DD/YYYY%20HH:MM~MM/DD/YYYY%20HH:MM
Do not use 24:00 as the time because it wraps around to 00:00. Use 23:59 instead.

request.description:
Average transactions per second (across all API calls, including errors) through the API in a given period of time.
Use the analytics metrics API to gather detailed metrics on the Virtual Power Plant Product (AEMO VPP Operations Forecast Data API).

Documentation reference: https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/use-analytics-api-measure-api-program-performance

StartFragment

Time ranges are in UTC.

To convert AEST to UTC, take away 10 hours from AEST (or 11 in daylight savings)

EndFragme

request.description: Gets an API proxy by name, including a list of existing revisions of the proxy.

item.name: List deployments for an API proxy
Get a deployment for an API proxy and actual state reported by runtime pods

request.description: Gets an API proxy by name, including a list of existing revisions of the proxy.

variable.description: Revision of the API Proxy to deploy. Must match an actual revision

request.description:
Deploy the API in the environment you want to with a revision number one higher than the already existing revisions.

Reference: [https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/reference/apis/apigee/rest/v1/organizations.environments.apis.revisions.deployments/deploy](https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/reference/apis/apigee/rest/v1/organizations.environments.apis.revisions.deployments/deploy)

`curl -v -u username:password -X POST http://localhost:8080/v1/organizations/{{org}}/apis/{{API}}/revisions//deployments?action=deploy\&env={{env}} -H "Content-Type: application/octet-stream"`

variable.description: Revision of the API Proxy to undeploy. Must match a deployed revision for that environment

request.description:
Undeploy revision before going ahead and removing any API's.

Reference: [https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/reference/apis/apigee/rest/v1/organizations.environments.apis.revisions.deployments/undeploy](https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/reference/apis/apigee/rest/v1/organizations.environments.apis.revisions.deployments/undeploy)

`curl -v -u username:password http://localhost:8080/v1/organizations//apis//revisions//deployments?action=undeploy\&env=\&force=true -X POST`

variable.description: The name of the API who's revision you wish to delete
The revision number of the API you're after

request.description:
Make sure all revisions of an API are removed before going ahead and undeploying an API

`curl -v -u username:password http://localhost:8080/v1/organizations/<orgname>/apis/<api you want to delete> -X DELETE`

item.name: Data Collectors

variable.description: string. Required. Name of the data collector in the following format: organizations/{org}/datacollectors/{dataCollectorId}.

item.description:
Data Collectors are used for capturing metrics and analytics from using the DataCapture policy.

You must have a data collector created to use DataCapture policies.

See [https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/reference/policies/data-capture-policy](https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/reference/policies/data-capture-policy)

API Reference:
https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/reference/apis/apigee/rest/v1/organizations.datacollectors

request.description:
Returns the profile for a developer by email address or ID. All time values are UNIX time values. The profile includes the developer's email address, ID, name, and other information.
Note the following:
With Apigee Edge for Public Cloud, the response includes only the first **100** apps.
Apigee recommends that you use the developer's email address when calling this API. Developer IDs are generated internally by Apigee and are not guaranteed to stay the same over time.

query.description: Optional. Set to true to list developers exanded with details.

Optional.

Note: This parameter can be used with Apigee Edge for Public Cloude only.

Limits the list to the number you specify. Use with the startKey parameter to provide more targeted filtering. The limit is 1000.

Optional.

Note: This parameter can be used with Apigee Edge for Public Cloud only.

To filter the keys that are returned, enter the email of a developer that the list will start with. For example, if the an unfiltered list returns:

westley@example.com
fezzik@example.com
buttercup@example.com

and your startKey is fezzik@example.com, the returned list will be

fezzik@example.com
buttercup@example.com

request.description:
Lists all developers and their details (e.g. their apps) in an organization by email address. This call does not list any company developers who are a part of the designated organization.

With Apigee Edge for Public Cloud:
A maximum of **1000** developers are returned per API call.
You can paginate the list of companies returned using the startKey and count query parameters

query.description:
Filters on various properties (e.g. filter=(request_verb%20in%20'POST','PUT'), and in sample value - the specific developer email

https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/use-analytics-api-measure-api-program-performance#filteringresults
https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/analytics-reference#filters

Use the select query parameter to specify the metrics to retrieve, and an optional aggregation function, in the form.

https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/use-analytics-api-measure-api-program-performance#specifying-the-metrics-to-return

Use the timeRange query paramater to specify the time period (US format), in the form:
MM/DD/YYYY%20HH:MM~MM/DD/YYYY%20HH:MM
Do not use 24:00 as the time because it wraps around to 00:00. Use 23:59 instead.

request.description:
Total traffic over a given period (across all API calls, including errors) for all API Products.
Use the filter query param for refining search results to particular proxies, verbs or call types.

Documentation reference: https://docs.apigee.com/api-platform/analytics/use-analytics-api-measure-api-program-performance

List the keystores in the environment

Adjust the number of nodes in your instance. Generally there is one instance per Organization (or you can think of it as one instance per GCP project).

Keep in mind each node costs $2.05/hour, and the minimum number of nodes will be deployed as always-on. For further details see here; https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/reference/pay-as-you-go

item.description:
To get started and make calls to the Apigee X API:

1. Get a token:
    1. From GCP Console:
        1. Login to the GCP Console
        2. Start a CLI session and switch to the Google cloud project you're running Apigee X from (`set project {project-id}`).
        3. Run this command and save the GCP token:  
            `gcloud auth application-default print-access-token`
    2. From Collection: TBC
2. Paste the token into an Environment variable called _gcp_oauth_token_
3. Subsequent calls will use this variable in an Auth Bearer header.
    

NOTE: There are other variables throughout the collection, where it is expected you have Environment variables set for these.
